abstract member Add : obj * string * string * string * int * string -> Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.ErrorObject
MemberSignature.Usage: errors.Add (varNode, bstrConditionName, bstrShortErrorMessage, bstrDetailedErrorMessage, lErrorCode, bstrType)

Docs.param: The XML node that the error will be associated with.
The short message for the error.
The detailed message for the error.
The error code of the error.
Default value is "modeless". The type of error processing. The other supported value is "modal".
Docs.summary: Adds an to and returns a reference to the new Error object.
Docs.returns: An object which represents the newly created Error.

remarks.para: The Add method is used to create custom error messages in a Microsoft InfoPath form. There are two types of errors that can be created using the Add method:

item.description: The user is notified of the error with an inline alert and can choose to return to the previous value with an undo operation

The user is notified of the error with a dialog box alert. After clicking OK in the dialog box alert, the error will appear as an inline alert and the user can choose to return to the previous value with an undo operation

remarks.para: Note: Custom errors can also be created using the method.
Important: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Delete (object varNode, string bstrConditionName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete(object varNode, string bstrConditionName) cil managed
Public Sub Delete (varNode As Object, bstrConditionName As String)
public: void Delete(System::Object ^ varNode, System::String ^ bstrConditionName);
abstract member Delete : obj * string -> unit

Docs.param: The XML Document Object Model (DOM) node associated with the error.
Docs.summary: Deletes the specified object from the collection.

remarks.para: The Delete method deletes all the Error objects in the Errors collection that are associated with the specified XML node and that have the same name. To delete all of the Error objects contained in the Errors collection, use the method.

Note: The Delete method will only delete errors that were created using the method. It cannot be used to delete errors that occur because of schema or data validation constraints, or errors that were created using the method.
Important: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteAll ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DeleteAll() cil managed
Public Sub DeleteAll ()
public: void DeleteAll();
abstract member DeleteAll : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Deletes all of the objects contained in the collection.

remarks.para: To delete a specific Error object from the Errors collection, use the Delete method.
Note: Unlike the method that will only delete errors that were created using the method, the DeleteAll method will delete all errors in the collection, regardless of how they were created.
Important: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

example.para: In the following example, the DeleteAll method of the collection is used to delete all the errors that it contains:

Docs.param: An expression that specifies the position of a member of the collection The argument must be a number from 0 to the value of the property minus 1.
Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the specified object from the collection.

remarks.para: If the value provided for the argument does not match any existing member of the collection, an error occurs.
After you have set a reference to the Error object that the Item method returns, you can access any of its properties or methods.
Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.
